title: Hollyoaks cast's adorable babies after Nadine Mulkerrin and Rory Douglas-Speed welcome son
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest soaps stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Hollyoaks couple Nadine Mulkerrin and Rory Douglas-Speed recently welcomed their first child together.

The baby boy was thought of as the first Hollyoaks baby, as he's the first born to two of the show's stars.

His mum plays Cleo McQueen, while his dad portrays Joel Dexter.

But little Reggie Speed is far from the first baby to be welcomed by one of the Channel 4 soap's actors.

Proud first-time dad Rory broke the news with an excited post, sharing the first picture of his new arrival being cradled in Nadine's arms.

"Welcome to the family wee Reggie Speed 15.8.19," he wrote.

(Image: Instagram)

"We love You man. So proud of Nadine, I didn't think I could love her anymore but my heart is bloody bursting! She was amazing throughout her labour. Women are seriously Superhuman x."

So which other cast members have become parents in recent years?

Kieron Richardson

Kieron, who plays Ste Hay, welcomed twins with his husband Carl Hyland in 2017.

The couple are proud dads to daughter Phoebe and son Chase.

(Image: Instagram)

And last year, Kieron said he was ready to try for baby number three.

He told Mirror Online at last year's British Soap Awards: "They're one now and we're going again for baby three very soon, because it is hard, so we'd like to get it out the way, and our surrogate wants to get her life back."

Stephanie Davis

Stephanie Davis, who recently returned to the soap as Sinead O'Connor, is a mum-of-one.

She welcomed son Caben-Albi with ex Jeremy McConnell in January 2017.

After returning to the soap, she had sparked up a romance with co-star Owen Warner, but they recently split.

(Image: Instagram)

Last year, Steph talked to Mirror Online about how much becoming a mum had changed her life.

She said: "It saved my life, 100%. I wouldn't have been here without it, or without Caben."

She added: "It's been hard, in all honesty, I'm not going to sugarcoat it. It is hard, but my mum's really good and if I need a break.

"We've decided recently she'll have him one day on the weekend for the whole day so I can get on top of the housework and get the washing done."

Lucy-Jo Hudson

Lucy-Jo, who starred in the soap as Donna-Marie Quinn, is expecting her second child.

She already shares daughter Sienna, five, with ex-husband Alan Halsall, who plays Tyrone Dobbs in Coronation Street , and now another little one is on the way.

(Image: Instagram)

Lucy-Jo recently revealed that she's expecting a baby with new boyfriend Lewis Devine.

Sharing a picture of her scan on social media, she said: "This has been so hard to keep quiet but today was the day @lewisdevine and I got to tell Sienna the best news!!!

"We are 13 weeks pregnant and so very excited to extend our little family.... Sienna is so excited to be a big sister.... and Lew is ecstatic to become a daddy for the first time and I am so happy to be having another gorgeous baby! No other feeling like it xxx."

Jennifer Metcalfe

Jennifer, who has played Mercedes McQueen since 2006, became a mum in June 2017.

The actress welcomed her first child with boyfriend Greg Lake, a former star of MTV reality show Geordie Shore.

(Image: Instagram)

They named their little boy Daye Colmic Lake.

Susie Amy

Susie, who joined the show as Scarlett, the wife of Luke, who was played by her former Footballers' Wives co-star Gary Lucy, became a mum earlier this year.

The actress welcomed her first child with boyfriend Raphael Bar.

(Image: Instagram)

She shared the news with the world on Instagram that they'd become parents to daughter Noah Liberty Jane Bar.

Chelsee Healy

Chelsee, who plays Goldie McQueen, is mum to Coco Valentine Healey Molly.

She welcomed her daughter in 2017.

And she loves being a mum.

(Image: Instagram)

She said after her daughter was born: "I feel more body confident now than before I had the baby. It’s ­actually not even about my body, but how I feel good within myself.

"Now I’ve been through pregnancy I’ve realised there are more important things in life and how you look isn’t the be all and end all."

Ali Bastian

Ali, who is known for her role as Becca Dean, recently announced she's expecting her first child.

The actress has a little one on the way with husband David O'Mahony, with the couple's due date falling days after their first wedding anniversary.

(Image: Doug Peters/EMPICS Entertainment)

Ali said she and and fellow actor David were feeling 'incredibly lucky' as she showed off her blossoming bump just months after suffering a heartbreaking miscarriage.

She told Hello! Magazine : "The moment I found out, I was so excited I could hardly speak."

description: Nadine and Rory recently welcomed their first child together - but they weren't the only Hollyoaks stars to become parents recently
